00001 // FastDelegate facility from CodeProject
00002 
00003 #ifndef __FASTDELEGATE_H
00004 #define __FASTDELEGATE_H
00005 
00006 #include <memory.h>
00007 
00009 //                                              Configuration options
00010 //
00012 
00013 // Uncomment the following #define for optimally-sized delegates.
00014 // In this case, the generated asm code is almost identical to the code you'd get
00015 // if the compiler had native support for delegates.
00016 // It will not work on systems where sizeof(dataptr) < sizeof(codeptr). 
00017 // Thus, it will not work for DOS compilers using the medium model.
00018 // It will also probably fail on some DSP systems.
00019 #define FASTDELEGATE_USESTATICFUNCTIONHACK
00020 
00021 // Uncomment the next line to allow function declarator syntax.
00022 // It is automatically enabled for those compilers where it is known to work.
00023 #define FASTDELEGATE_ALLOW_FUNCTION_TYPE_SYNTAX
00024 
00025 
00026 
00027 
00029 //                                              Compiler identification for workarounds
00030 //
00032 
00033 // Compiler identification. It's not easy to identify Visual C++ because
00034 // many vendors fraudulently define Microsoft's identifiers.
00035 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__MWERKS__) && !defined(__VECTOR_C) && !defined(__ICL) && !defined(__BORLANDC__)
00036 #define FASTDLGT_ISMSVC
00037 
00038 #if (_MSC_VER <1300) // Many workarounds are required for VC6.
00039 #define FASTDLGT_VC6
00040 #pragma warning(disable:4786) // disable this ridiculous warning
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 // Does the compiler uses Microsoft's member function pointer structure?
00046 // If so, it needs special treatment.
00047 // Metrowerks CodeWarrior, Intel, and CodePlay fraudulently define Microsoft's 
00048 // identifier, _MSC_VER. We need to filter Metrowerks out.
00049 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__MWERKS__)
00050 #define FASTDLGT_MICROSOFT_MFP
00051 
00052 #if !defined(__VECTOR_C)
00053 // CodePlay doesn't have the __single/multi/virtual_inheritance keywords
00054 #define FASTDLGT_HASINHERITANCE_KEYWORDS
00055 #endif
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 // Does it allow function declarator syntax? The following compilers are known to work:
00059 #if defined(FASTDLGT_ISMSVC) && (_MSC_VER >=1310) // VC 7.1
00060 #define FASTDELEGATE_ALLOW_FUNCTION_TYPE_SYNTAX
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 // Gcc(2.95+), and versions of Digital Mars, Intel and Comeau in common use.
00064 #if defined (__DMC__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__ICL) || defined(__COMO__)
00065 #define FASTDELEGATE_ALLOW_FUNCTION_TYPE_SYNTAX
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 // It works on Metrowerks MWCC 3.2.2. From boost.Config it should work on earlier ones too.
00069 #if defined (__MWERKS__)
00070 #define FASTDELEGATE_ALLOW_FUNCTION_TYPE_SYNTAX
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 #ifdef __GNUC__ // Workaround GCC bug #8271 
00074         // At present, GCC doesn't recognize constness of MFPs in templates
00075 #define FASTDELEGATE_GCC_BUG_8271
00076 #endif
00077 
00078 
00079 
00080 
00081 
00083 //                                              General tricks used in this code
00084 //
00085 // (a) Error messages are generated by typdefing an array of negative size to
00086 //     generate compile-time errors.
00087 // (b) Warning messages on MSVC are generated by declaring unused variables, and
00088 //          enabling the "variable XXX is never used" warning.
00089 // (c) Unions are used in a few compiler-specific cases to perform illegal casts.
00090 // (d) For Microsoft and Intel, when adjusting the 'this' pointer, it's cast to
00091 //     (char *) first to ensure that the correct number of *bytes* are added.
00092 //
00094 
00095 namespace reflection 
00096 {
00097 
00098         #define DELEG_MAX_INVOKE_PARAMS 8
00099         typedef void (*deleg_generic_invoke)(void*, void**, void*);
00100 
00102         //                                              Helper templates
00103         //
00105         #include "Delegate_utils.h"
00106 
00107 
00108 
00110         //                                              Fast Delegates, part 2:
00111         //
00112         //      Define the delegate storage, and cope with static functions
00113         //
00115         #include "Delegate_funcdata.h"  
00116         #include "Delegate_closure.h"
00117 
00118 
00119 
00121         //                                              Fast Delegates, part 3:
00122         //
00123         //                              Wrapper classes to ensure type safety
00124         //
00126         #include "Delegate_deleg.h"
00127 
00128 
00130         //                                              Fast Delegates, part 4:
00131         // 
00132         //                              Delegate<> class (Original author: Jody Hagins)
00133         //      Allows boost::function style syntax like:
00134         //                      Delegate< double (int, long) >
00135         // instead of:
00136         //                      Delegate2< int, long, double >
00137         //
00139         #include "Delegate_funcstyle.h"
00140 
00141 
00142 
00144         //                                              Fast Delegates, part 5:
00145         //
00146         //                              MakeDelegate() helper function
00147         //
00148         //                      MakeDelegate(&x, &X::func) returns a fastdelegate of the type
00149         //                      necessary for calling x.func() with the correct number of arguments.
00150         //                      This makes it possible to eliminate many typedefs from user code.
00151         //
00153         #define DELEG_CONST
00154         #include "Delegate_makedeleg.h"
00155         #undef DELEG_CONST
00156         #define DELEG_CONST const
00157         #include "Delegate_makedeleg.h"
00158         #undef DELEG_CONST
00159 
00160         template <class FT>
00161         Delegate<FT> MakeDelegate(FT* func) { return Delegate<FT>(func); }
00162         
00163 
00164 } // namespace
00165 
00166 #endif // __FASTDELEGATE_H
